page.title: 05CATTERLEN VILLAGE PENRITH
page.content: At the top of Catterlen village there is an old school house. The school closed before 1924.The River Petteril is the boundary between Newton Reigny and Catterlen.There is also the M6 motorway as the boundary at the other end of the village as it goes straight through farmland. A well-known face lives in our village:Neil Doughty, who won the 1983 Grand National with his horse "Hello Dandy".About half- way up the village there is Catterlen Wood. Neil Doughty lives opposite the wood. There is now a good road,the B5305 that's past the bottom of the village. There is also a road that runs through the village and on to Newton Reigny and Laithes.There used to be an old Blacksmith's but it has closed and some other people live in the house now.
